issue.title: package.xml for easy integration with catkin/ament

content.raw:
I believe the reason is what you mentioned, Ignition libraries are independent of the ROS ecosystem. We could add the file to all libraries, but it would be one more file to keep updated, which is prone to errors (unless we add some CI checks perhaps).

Alternatively, I recommend you use `colcon` instead of `catkin`, which solves that problem by finding dependencies directly from `CMakeLists`. It works with ROS 1, ROS 2, Ignition and Gazebo. Ignition's [from source](https://ignitionrobotics.org/docs/blueprint/install#option-3-source-installation-any-platform-) build instructions use `colcon`.

issue.title: package.xml for easy integration with catkin/ament

content.raw: I also had maintained some package.xml files for ignition packages ( https://bitbucket.org/scpeters/unix-stuff/src/master/package_xml/ ), but I've stopped using catkin with them and started using `colcon` instead, as @chapulina mentioned. `colcon` automatically identifies the correct build order by parsing the `find_package` calls in the `CMakeLists.txt` files. The one thing this method doesn't support is installing missing dependencies with `rosdep`, but I wasn't using that functionality with ignition.
